algorithm_technique: Iterate through the array, counting changes in direction (up/down) of differences between consecutive elements.
problem_summary_simple: Find the longest subsequence where differences between consecutive numbers alternate signs.
problem_summary_technical: Greedily count peaks and valleys in the sequence by tracking the direction of the last difference.
key_insights: The problem can be solved greedily by focusing on the turning points (peaks and valleys).
We only need to keep track of the sign of the previous difference.
Consecutive equal numbers do not contribute to the wiggle sequence length.
